ai.summary: North Bucks Way is a challenging long-distance trail in the United Kingdom, totaling 124.5 km. It traverses rural countryside with a mix of country lanes, fields and woodlands, offering varied terrain and several long days on the trail. Suitable for experienced hikers prepared for sustained effort.
ai.terrain_summary: The route features a mix of surfaced lanes, grassy paths, farm tracks and woodland sections. Expect rolling countryside, occasional gentle ascents, uneven footing and gates or stiles. Distances are long, so plan for multi-day hiking or long-day itineraries.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for variable UK weather and remote stretches. Carry a map and compass (and know how to use them), ensure a charged phone, and inform someone of your itinerary. Bring sufficient water and food, a first-aid kit, a weatherproof layer, sturdy boots, and emergency warmth. Some sections have few services; be prepared for long gaps between towns.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots or trail shoes
Map and compass (or GPS device) and knowledge to use them
Snack and meal supplies for long days

seo.title: North Bucks Way – 124.5 km long-distance hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore the North Bucks Way, a demanding 124.5 km hike through countryside and woodlands in the United Kingdom. Learn about terrain, safety tips, gear, and the best seasons for this route.
seo.h1: North Bucks Way – 124.5 km Long-Distance Hike in the UK
